CatDescriptText: George W. Lindenfelder, salesman, 921 Wible Run Road, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 31, 1959, pg. 32 with question: "Do you believe in capital punishment? If so, do you  think that it should be imposed on convicted defendants under the age of 21?" answer reads: "I don't agree on capital punishment in any case, and the reason why is that I'm a Catholic."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George W. Lindenfelder wearing dark fedora, diagonally striped necktie, and dark overcoat, holding dark item under left arm, standing on sidewalk with other people and buildings with signs, including one that reads "Quality Finan..."
